text: Hi everybody! My name is Emy Maru and I am a resident at Karolinska university hospital in Stockholm, Sweden. Currently I am on my last week of cardio rotation, but after that I will be back at the department of emergency/internal medicine where we are handling covid19 patients. I am also in a whatsapp group with very competent Ethiopian medical doctors, where we share information and updates about the covid19 outbreak.

text: Hi team, Kiersten here. I work for Kidame Mart an Ethiopian social enterprise that runs the largest female led rural distribution channel. We recruit rural women to become agents selling high impact products to their communities (soap, water filters, fortified nutrition products). We currently have 2,000 women across 7 regions reaching up to 1 million rural Ethiopians.                                                                      We are looking for help to scale up our distribution of soap and use this channel to deliver Covid-19 information campaigns (how to wash hands, preventative measures etc.) We need <https://www.paypal.com/donate/?token=u5muIOPJ9AfQO8B1Plm-as4qKwPM4RvKAV3cPLDwHWHdSZ1UeN60hI0AcALRgfgoir6wDG&country.x=US&locale.x=US|financial support (paypal donations via partner Florida Africa Foundation)>, training materials, and partners to make this happen ASAP. As for *training materials*, we are looking for flyers and visual materials that could help illiterate individuals understand the ways to prevent corona and properly wash hands. Also looking for any materials on *corona prevention and hand washing in Tigrinya and Oromo*. As for partners, anyone that has products that need to be distributed to rural areas or has messaging/information campaigns please get in touch.

text:
Hey there, <@U0106DA1LGJ>! Such an admirable mission. Thanks for all that you guys do! Let’s get right into it!

Regarding info campaigns: we plan to ship a bunch of material via our partners; popular social media accounts/orgs & influencers *on Wednesday*, follow <#CV8GEDED8|awareness-partners> for updates. Will add you to the spreadsheet partners list.

Regarding financial support; you are more than welcome to share a gofundme link to <#C0104D5J3T2|all-general> if you have one, so people of our community can decide to help. Otherwise, we can’t really push funding formally, as we’re more of a project based community of builders.

Lastly, please clarify; training materials, & what “partners” look like to an org like yours, during this time.

text:
Good day! <@U0107A7161E> wanted me to share here a bit more about a solution that I've been working on with an MIT team, which is a citizen-centric open source ‘privacy-first’ digital solution for contact tracing for COVID-19 spread. It has three components: mobile app (<http://safepapths.mit.edu/|PrivateKit>), tools for health officials (SafePlaces) and plug-ins for partners. The digital *contact tracing using overlapped GPS trails* allows an individual to check if they have crossed paths with someone who was later diagnosed with the infection. Team is MIT, Harvard, Mayo and various startups. And the Mobile App (PrivateKit) is now available on playstore.

*Privacy*: We use either *on-device* calculation or use *encrypted trail match* with mathematical guarantees of privacy. Thus it avoids the ‘big brother’ surveillance state problem we see in China and South Korea where GPS matching solutions have been very effective but are <https://arxiv.org/abs/2003.08567|draconian>. The misinformation and distrust can cause civil unrest in a heterogeneous society.

*Why*: The approach will reduce panic that overwhelm healthcare systems and allow selective interventions rather than shutting down all socio-economic activity. So we expect this tool to empower not just an individual but also city officials and businesses that must keep continue the operations. Our research group has devised a series of solutions over the years for *civil resilience*. <https://splitlearning.github.io/> 

*Status*: We are finishing up contract negotiations with WHO and other key organizations. The solution is being built by a consortium of epidemiologists, engineers, data scientists, digital privacy evangelists, professors and researchers from reputable institutions. WHO, HHS and the Govt of India, Italy, Germany, Vietnam and many others are guiding the development. 

*Future plans*: In the early phases, emphasis is on rapid iteration and deployment for GPS-overlap solutions for contact tracing. In the later phases, the goal is *building encrypted computational methods that can be useful in any future societal disruptions.*
